text: is a Japanese musician. He is a co-founder of the Japanese band rock X Japan. He also founded an independent record label Extasy Records. X Japan ended in 1997. They got back together in 2007 and are currently touring worldwide. Yoshiki's solo career includes two classical studio albums: Eternal Melody (1993), and Eternal Melody II (2005). ==References== Category:Musicians from Chiba Prefecture Category:Living people Category:1965 births
title: Yoshiki
